result.execSummary:
The defendant Richard J. Geier was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Theft-False Representation >$10,000, a class G felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(d).
  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).
  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: *AMENDMENT 12-1-2020 - Pursuant to Probation review hearing and Order of the Court, probation is extended 2 years and is to pay $100.00 per month towards restitution.

miscConds.notes: Pay restitution in the amount of $36,618.40 and restitution surcharge.

Pay court costs.   **NOTE: THE DEFENDANT IS ORDERED TO PAY ALL COURT OBLIGATIONS TO THE CLERK OF COURTS OFFICE.   Payment is due within 30 days.  If the Defendant cannot make the payment, he/she must report to the Clerk of Courts Office to set up a payment plan.  Failure to comply will result in other collection methods including a civil Judgment and/or suspension of your drivers license for two (2) years.  This judgment may be collected by income assignment if you fail to pay fines and costs as ordered.
----------------------------

IT IS HEREBY ORDERED THAT the defendant's excess work release funds be applied to any & all outstanding Court obligations while serving his mandatory jail sentence.
----------------------------

No contact with victim without victim's and probation agent's consent.
----------------------------

Counseling as recommended by Probation Agent.   Provide biological specimen to state crime lab for DNA analysis, and pay DNA analysis surcharge.   The defendant must pay Department of Corrections Supervision fees.
----------------------------

timeConds.notes:
to commence on or before 2-19-2016 at 8:00 a.m. with work release privileges. 
May travel to Illinois for employment purposes.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
10:30 am PROBATION REVIEW HEARING:
ADA Matthew R. Leusink appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Probation Agent Janilee Wolff appears.  
Defendant Richard J. Geier appeared by phone.  He is at home in Illinois
Victims are present in court.  
Matter is before the Court for a probation review hearing.  
Agent Wolff advises that since Mr.Geier's last probation review hearing, he has been making consistent payments.  Deft collects social security disability.  DOC feels he has made a good faith effort.  Response by Mr. Geier to Court's questions. He receives $700 per month in disability.  Response by Atty Leusink.  Statement by Defendant.  Statement by victim.  Deft lives with his Mother.  Deft has anxiety and depression and when he gets stressed out, he tends to hurt himself.  Further response by victim.  10:51 am  Court thinks that given that the first 2 & 1/2 years were minimal payments, Court will extend probation for another 2 years and he is to pay $100 per month toward restitution.  Agent Wolff will submit an Order and Court will prepare an Amended JOC.
Memo from DOC re: PRH 11-20
Emails between Prob Agent & Clerk, re: Deft's appearance by phone
Probation review hearing on November 20, 2020 at 10:30 am.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Letter from Prob Agent Wolff, re:  Court Review Hearing / Deft's consistent payments since May, 2018

* 9/26/18 - The Court agrees.  Hearing shall be removed.  KED  [lb]
Review hearing on October 10, 2018 at 11:00 am.
Memo from DOC  re: status of Probation

8:35 am PROBATION REVIEW HEARING:  
Appearances:  
Special Prosecutor Robert Jambois, appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Probation Agent Janilee Wolff is present.  
Defendant Richard J. Geier appeared.  Defendant's mother is also presen as well as the victims in this case.  
Court notes deft has been brought back to court repeatedly to find out why Mr. Geier is not making payments.  Court has a letter from Agent Wolff stating she had heard nothing from him, or from his Illinois probation agent.   Atty Wolff advises that she did have recent contact from Mr. Geier advising that he has applied for disability - He applied in February - and it is currently under a review process.  The Illinois Agent has not been responding to Agent Wollf's inquiries.  Mr. Geier states that Social Security has advised him that it is very likely he will receive disability.  Court advises that typically a request for disability is initially denied.  Court expresses concern that the Illinois Agent doesn't seem to be monitoring him at all.  Court is getting close to revoking defendant's ability to be under Illinois supervision and that he may need to be supervised here in Wisconsin.  There have only been 2 payments since supervision began.  Last payment was in November of 2016.  Court indicates this is not acceptable.  Deft has not worked at all since his last probation review.  His mom and dad support him.  He indicates he has back due child support of approximately $4,000.  The Victims are present in Court.  Court will put this on for review in 6 months.  Court wants to know where he is with his social security application and also see if he has made any payments.  Court asks what he does on a daily basis.  He states that he reads and tries to get by everyday.  His social anxiety makes it hard for him to do anything.  Defendant says he has tried calling the person who is supervising him in Illinois but they never contact him.  Court asks Agent to check as to whether the Court can return his probation supervision to the State of Wisconsin.  Court expects to see that Mr. Geier has made some kind of payment toward restitution and makes contact with his Illinois agent - Ms. Wolff will reach out to them as to what is going on - Ms. Geier is to show proof to Agent of social security status and all of that information.  8:46 am  Court in recess.
Memo from DOC re: Pobation Review Hearing

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
10:12 am  Court in session.  
DA Zeke S Wiedenfeld appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant Richard J. Geier appeared.  
Probation Agent Janilee Wollf appears on behalf of DOC.  Matter is on this morning at request of DOC for a probation review hearing.  Victims are present in the courtroom.  In November 2016, the Court had ordered Mr. Geier to make payments of $500 per month.  Defendant has not made any payments since that Order was made by the Court.  Agent Wolff requested a progress report from Illinois and received no information as to defendant's employment and treatment.  Illinois probation did later respond and indicated he had been employed and struggling with mental health issues.  Response by Mr. Geier to Court's questions.  He has not been working.  He has been in and out of the hospital with mental health issues.  He was last in the hospital in Naperville Psychiatric in August of this year.  He says he was in there for a couple of weeks.  Mr. Geier suffers from clinical anxiety, severe depression and PTSD.  He has been hospitalized 6 or 7 times in the last year.  He last worked last year.  He is not able to work at all because of his anxiety.  He lives with his mother.  Defendant says he has been in Court with regard to his child.  He is terminating his parental rights.  He has no financial savings, IRA's, deferred comp.  He has a checking account but there is no money in it.  He borrows his parents' car when needs to go some place.  Defendant makes record as to the medications he is taking.  He says he has suffered from suicide ideations. 
10:21 am  Argument by Atty Wiedenfeld.  He notes that we are 2 years into supervision and there has been no payments since making one $500.00 payment.  
10:23 am  Court makes record.  Court will schedule a review hearing in 6 months.  Probation should be provided with medical records.  Probation review hearing scheduled for April 27, 2018 at 08:30 am.
10-19-2017 Letter from Probation Agent Janilee Wollf, re:  Court review scheduled for October 26th
Probation review hearing on October 26, 2017 at 10:00 am.
Letter from Prob. Agent Wolff requesting Court Review be scheduled

8:30 am  Court in session.  Case called.  Appearances given.  
ADA Diane M. Donohoo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Victims are present.  
Defendant Richard J. Geier not in court.  
Probation Agent Janilee Wollf is present in Court.  
This was set on at the request of Ms. Wolff at the request of the victims in this matter.  Court had held a review hearing in November of last year.  Defendant is not present.  An hour or so ago, Agent Wolff received an e-mail from deft's mother that he had made an attempt on his life.  Ms. Wolff doesn't know the current status of his health.  December 12, 2020 is his discharge date from probation.  Response by Atty Donohoo. Court asks that Ms. Wolff monitor the situation and if she feels it needs to be set on for review, she can contact the court to put it back on the calendar.
Received Documents - 4/7/2017 Letter from Prob Agent Janilee Wollf, status report for upcoming review hearing
Received Documents - 3/8/2017 E-mail requesting from Prob. Agent Wollf requesting review hearing

8:58 am  Court in session.  Case Called.  
DDA Haley Jo Johnson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant Richard J. Geier appeared.  
Probation Agent Janilee Wolff appears on behalf of DOC.  
The victims are also present in court.  
Matter is before the Court for a probation review hearing.  Mr. Geier indicates he was unemployed and just got a job.  He says it has been a struggle getting work because of his felony convictions.  He was a golf professional and a musician.  He can no longer work as a golf professional because of his convictions.  He is looking for stable employment.  He has a child on the way.  He has been living with his parents.  The last time he was employed was July.  He was working for Diamond Blade Warehouse but the commute was too long and he was spending a lot of money on gas.  Agent Wolff is asking that the importance of making payments be impressed upon him.  She wants to reach an agreement today as to what a fair and reasonable monthly payment should be.  Mr. Geier has $--- that he can pay today.  He now works at Future Payment Systems which is commission based.  He hopes to make a minimum of $--- per month.  Court advises Mr. Geier that If he doesn't make enough money there - he may have to look for another job.  Mr. Geier says he has court on December 2nd in Illinois with regard to child support.  Atty Johnson believes $--- per month would be a good faith effort.  Court notes the bottom line is that he stole a lot of money from the victims and he needs to pay it back.  Court expects Mr. Geier to make this a priority.  Agent Wolff's recommendation is that he pay $500 per month.  Court orders that he pay $--- per month.  He is to turn over the $--- he brought with him today to Ms. Wolff.   The $--- payments are due on the 11th of each month.   9:10 am  Court in recess.
Probation review hearing on November 11, 2016 at 09:00 am.
Defendant Richard J. Geier in court with attorney Jason Sanders.  Cody John Horlacher appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes filed.
BOND QUASHED

Defendant Richard J. Geier in court with attorney Jason Sanders.  Valerian A Powell appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Parties have an agreement. Minutes filed.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for January 19, 2016 at 01:15 pm.
Not guilty pleas entered
Defendant Richard J. Geier in court with attorney Jason Sanders.  Diane M. Donohoo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Minutes filed.  Status conference scheduled for November 19, 2015 at 01:15 pm.
Plaintiff's Demand and Motion for Discovery and Inspection.  Notice of Motion and Motion for Establishment of Discovery Deadlines.
Atty Jason Sanders

Defendant Richard J. Geier in court with attorney Jason Sanders.  Diane M. Donohoo appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court enters not guilty plea. Minutes filed.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 21, 2015 at 03:00 pm.
Defendant present in court, in custody with Atty Hammock. ADA Rea appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Minutes filed.

  Defendant will not in any way contact or attempt to contact any victim(s) listed and will avoid their residence/place of employment or any place they are located and will avoid causing any other person, other than defendant's attorney, from doing so on defendant's behalf.  The term "no contact" is hereby defined as through the mail, by telephone, by way of electronic device, in person, or through a third party.  VICTIM(S)/RESIDENCE(S): NO CONTACT WITH M.H. or G.H.
